question.content: Do you have any Massachusetts W2 employees or 1099-MISC contractors?

options.label: No
options.message: You are not required to participate in the PFML program.

question.content: How many Massachusetts W2 employees have you employed in the last 12 months?
How many Massachusetts 1099-MISC contractors have worked for you in the last 12 months?

paragraph.content: Based on the makeup of your workforce, all your W2 employees and 1099-MISC contractors are eligible for PFML benefits and will be referred to as “qualifying workers.”
paragraph.helpText: If 1099-MISC contractors make up more than half of your workforce, they are considered qualifying workers and you are responsible for sending contributions on their behalf.

paragraph.content: Starting July 1, 2019, you are required to send the employee share of the contribution every quarter to the Department of Family and Medical Leave for each of your W2 employees and 1099-MISC contractors.
You are also required to pay the employer share of the contribution for medical leave.
paragraph.helpText: If you have 25 or more qualifying workers, you are required to pay the employer share.

paragraph.content: Based on the makeup of your workforce, only your W2 employees are eligible for PFML benefits and will be referred to as “qualifying workers.”
paragraph.helpText: If 1099-MISC contractors make up less than half of your workforce, they are not considered qualifying workers and you are not responsible for sending contributions on their behalf.

paragraph.content: Starting July 1, 2019, you are required to send the employee share of the contribution every quarter to the Department of Family and Medical Leave for each of your W2 employees.
You are also required to pay the employer share of the contribution for medical leave.
paragraph.helpText: If you have 25 or more qualifying workers, you need to pay the employer share.

paragraph.content: Starting July 1, 2019, you are required to send the employee share of the contribution every quarter to the Department of Family and Medical Leave for each of your qualified workers.
You are not required to pay the employer share of the contribution for family or medical leave.
